intro: Racosperma elongatum, commonly known as the slender racosperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-like fruits and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers are small and usually yellow or pale green, arranged in dense clusters.
